nodes.bodyText: This is member-access, not optional-field-access. Shall we move these tests to member-access tests and add some optional field access tests here? Please include some optional field tests for both too.
Done

This is similar to the previous test but with a Bar1 instead of a Foo1 right?
Shall we change this a bit and make fb to be of type Foo1|Bar1 instead? Without the ().
Done
I suggest we make these closed records for the time-being, since they'll most likely result in a compilation error with changes for #22800.
Done

IMO the method name does not say much about what the method actually does, and the variable name kinda implies the check returns if all the members are records, which from the impl. doesn't seem to be the case. Can we rename?

Do we need to do this? Can we not just iterate through the fields of the BRecordType and figure out if the field exists?
symResolver.resolveStructField could log errors right, even thought it may not atm?
@pubudu91 thoughts?
This would log an error if at least one record type doesn't have the field name given by field right?
And yeah, we don't usually use this to lookup whether the a record has a field by the specified name.
Done
Shall we rename this to indicate it returns () on match all?
Variable name. :)
This seems to be duplicating quite a bit of code from getSuccessPattern. Can we try and refactor getSuccessPattern instead to handle the record scenario?
Done
What's this condition about?
This method check whether all types are records except error type and nil type.
